message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SY. 

The paper focuses on recurrent neural networks, which are commonly used in machine learning and fall under the category of deep learning. The paper also discusses the use of state-regularization, which is a mechanism for improving the performance of RNNs. Based on these factors, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper also evaluates the performance of state-regularized RNNs on various tasks such as sentiment analysis, visual object recognition, and language modeling, which fall under the sub-categories of cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Additionally, the paper discusses the use of state-regularization to simplify the extraction of finite state automata, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). 

Finally, the paper also discusses the shortcomings of RNNs in handling long-term memorization, which falls under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). 

Therefore, the likely sub-categories in order of most to least likely are: cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.NE.
